items.description:
Hey everyone!

I hope you have all had a great week!

Yet more great links for you to enjoy and as ever, thanks to everyone who contributed. Always great to see so much love for Xamarin.Forms.

It's a big week for Xamarin with the stable release of Xamarin.Forms 4.5! Check out the Microsoft Blog featured in the newsletter, where David Ortinau takes you through 5 things to know about 4.5!

The agenda has also been announced for the DotNETConf: Focus on Xamarin event on March 23rd, and I am excited to announce I will be speaking!!

Have a fantastic week, keep up the great community posts and see you next week!

Luce üß°

Have a fantastic week, keep up the great community posts and see you next week!

Luce üß°

items.title: Learn how to get the most out of Xamarin.Forms
Xamarin.Forms 4.5 Stable Release Available!
items.description:
Every new release of Xamarin.Forms contains dozens of improvements. Today, we are thrilled to share that Xamarin.Forms 4.5 is now available bringing you AndroidX, new capabilities for creating responsive UI, and controls ‚Äúin the box‚Äù to speed your development. Let‚Äôs look at what is new in Xamarin.Forms 4.5 with several features to get excited about!

Xamarin.Forms 4.5 Stable Release Available! by David Ortinau
items.description_markdown:
Every new release of Xamarin.Forms contains dozens of improvements. Today, we are thrilled to share that Xamarin.Forms 4.5 is now available bringing you AndroidX, new capabilities for creating responsive UI, and controls ‚Äúin the box‚Äù to speed your development. [**Xamarin.Forms 4.5 Stable Release Available!**](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/xamarin/xamarin-forms-4-5/) by [David Ortinau](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/xamarin/author/davidortinau/)

items.title: Xamarin.Forms: Native API Acces with Dependency Injection
items.description:
Dependency Injection is a great technique for leveraging native code in the context of your shared code. In Xamarin.Forms you typically create a custom renderer which gives you native access. If you need to run some native code from the shared context you can easily do this with the built-in Dependency Injection tooling.

Xamarin.Forms: Native API Acces with Dependency Injection by Andrew Hoefling
items.description_markdown:
Dependency Injection is a great technique for leveraging native code in the context of your shared code. In Xamarin.Forms you typically create a custom renderer which gives you native access. If you need to run some native code from the shared context you can easily do this with the built-in Dependency Injection tooling.

[**Xamarin.Forms: Native API Acces with Dependency Injection**](https://www.andrewhoefling.com/Blog/Post/xamarin-forms-native-api-acces-with-dependency-injection) by [Andrew Hoefling](https://twitter.com/andrew_hoefling)

embedded_links.title: **Xamarin.Forms: Native API Acces with Dependency Injection**

items.title: How To Confirm Exit in Android with Xamarin Forms
items.description:
Ever hit the navigation bar back button when using an Android app and have it fully exit the app and drop you back on your home screen? I think all Android users have encountered this a few times. It is a frustrating and counter-productive experience. Let‚Äôs make sure your app has better UX by using a simple confirmation dialog!

How To Confirm Exit in Android with Xamarin Forms by Dylan Berry
items.description_markdown:
Ever hit the navigation bar back button when using an Android app and have it fully exit the app and drop you back on your home screen? I think all Android users have encountered this a few times. [**How To Confirm Exit in Android with Xamarin Forms**](https://www.dylanberry.com/2020/02/20/how-to-confirm-exit-in-android-with-xamarin-forms/) by [Dylan Berry](https://twitter.com/dylbot9000)

items.title: Fill PDF Forms on the Go with Import and Export Form Data Support in Xamarin PDF Viewer
items.description:
Are you frequently filling PDF forms in your Xamarin mobile application? Are you annoyed at entering basic details like your name, email address, and phone number again and again? Then Syncfusion have a solution to your problem.

Fill PDF Forms on the Go with Import and Export Form Data Support in Xamarin PDF Viewer by Ramkumar Ravy
items.description_markdown:
Are you frequently filling PDF forms in your Xamarin mobile application? Are you annoyed at entering basic details like your name, email address, and phone number again and again? Then Syncfusion have a solution to your problem.

[**Fill PDF Forms on the Go with Import and Export Form Data Support in Xamarin PDF Viewer**](https://www.syncfusion.com/blogs/post/fill-pdf-forms-with-import-and-export-form-data-in-xamarin-pdf-viewer.aspx) by [Ramkumar Ravy](https://www.syncfusion.com/blogs/author/ramkumarrsyncfusion-com)

items.title: Cross platform tray bar applications with Xamarin.Forms
items.description:
Ever wondered how to create a tray/menu item bar application? It turns out you can do just that with Xamarin.Forms and Konrad shows you how!

Cross platform tray bar applications with Xamarin.Forms by Konrad M√ºller
items.description_markdown:
Ever wondered how to create a tray/menu item bar application? It turns out you can do just that with Xamarin.Forms and Konrad shows you how!

items.title: TaskLoaderView & Lottie Best Friends Forever
items.description:
Lottie is a cross-platform library created by Twitter, then wrapped in a cool Xamarin.Forms view by Martijn van Dijk, allowing you to bring a unique identity to your app with animations. TaskLoaderView is a state container from Sharpnado, and in this post, Jean-Marie shows you how you can combine the two to bring exciting animations to your app depending on the state.

TaskLoaderView & Lottie Best Friends Forever by Jean-Marie Alfonsi
items.description_markdown:
Lottie is a cross-platform library created by Twitter, then wrapped in a cool Xamarin.Forms view by Martijn van Dijk, allowing you to bring a unique identity to your app with animations. TaskLoaderView is a state container from Sharpnado, and in this post, Jean-Marie shows you how you can combine the two to bring exciting animations to your app depending on the state.

[**TaskLoaderView & Lottie Best Friends Forever**](https://www.sharpnado.com/taskloaderview-lottie-best-friends-forever/) by [Jean-Marie Alfonsi](https://www.sharpnado.com/author/roubachof/)

items.title: Using AutoMapper in your Xamarin Forms apps
items.description:
Whenever you are creating a larger Xamarin Forms application, you usually end up with different models representing similar data but for different areas of your app. For example, you will get a minimalist Data Transfer Object (DTO) from your backend, which you might copy into another app-internal model or directly to the View Model representing the data displayed on your view. And this is where AutoMapper will help you out and prevent you from writing all that copy code.

Using AutoMapper in your Xamarin Forms apps by Mark Allibone
items.description_markdown:
Whenever you are creating a larger Xamarin Forms application, you usually end up with different models representing similar data but for different areas of your app. For example, you will get a minimalist Data Transfer Object (DTO) from your backend, which you might copy into another app-internal model or directly to the View Model representing the data displayed on your view. And this is where AutoMapper will help you out and prevent you from writing all that copy code.

[**Using AutoMapper in your Xamarin Forms apps**](https://mallibone.com/post/xamarin-automapper) by [Mark Allibone](https://twitter.com/mallibone)

embedded_links.title: **Using AutoMapper in your Xamarin Forms apps**

items.title: Exploring Grial UI Kit in Xamarin Forms
items.description:
Grial UI Kit provides XAML templates, custom controls, helpers and resources that accelerate the creation of Xamarin.Forms apps. In this article, Charlin explores the Grial UI Kit, talking about how to use it, pricing and some personal feedback.

Exploring Grial UI Kit in Xamarin Forms by Charlin Agramonte
items.description_markdown:
Grial UI Kit provides XAML templates, custom controls, helpers and resources that accelerate the creation of Xamarin.Forms apps. In this article, Charlin explores the Grial UI Kit, talking about how to use it, pricing and some personal feedback.

[**Exploring Grial UI Kit in Xamarin Forms**](https://xamgirl.com/exploring-grial-ui-kit-in-xamarin-forms/) by [Charlin Agramonte](https://twitter.com/Chard003)

embedded_links.title: **Exploring Grial UI Kit in Xamarin Forms**

items.title: Merge Conflict: 190: The Creation of Appstat with Frank
items.description:

items.title: Custom Vision, Xamarin.Forms and Simpsons - The Community AI Show
items.description:
A new Community AI Show with Henk Boelman has launched and the first guest was none other than one of our favourite community members turned Microsoft employee Gerald Versluis! In this inaugural episode, Gerald shows off one of my favourite services, Custom Vision and how you can combine that with a Xamarin.Forms app and..The Simpsons!

Custom Vision, Xamarin.Forms and Simpsons - The Community AI Show by Gerald Versluis
items.description_markdown:
